items.title: Help & Donate
items.summary: If you liked what we're doing and would like to support our work, you can donate in three ways: 1. Volunteer remote work - with…
items.content_html:
If you liked what we're doing and would like to support our work, you can donate in three ways:

1. Volunteer remote work - with the content, website, social networks etc.
2. Volunteer offline work - on the spot help with event organising (example: multimedia engineers, hands-on help, etc.).
3. Donate directly (crypto or fiat) to our community.

We are setting up the non-commercial entity now that will accept donations.

Meanwhile, you can donate directly to organiser:

Den Ivanov (Linkedin, Facebook, Telegram)

items.title: Feedback
items.summary: We are always striving to improve the quality of our events and would like to hear your feedback. What we could improve? Change? Embrace? Tell…
items.content_html:
We are always striving to improve the quality of our events and would like to hear your feedback.

What we could improve? Change? Embrace? Tell us!

We're working on making a completely free (from tracking etc) feedback form for you to fill.

Right now, please share your feedback via feedback@itmeet.top.

If you liked our event, you can also support us by:

  • doing an awesome speech on important topic, 
  • inviting a guest speaker,
  • becoming a partner,
  • taking a bunch of friends on the next ITM event, 
  • joining us and sharing your feedback on the social networks, 
  • helping as volunteer or donating.

items.title: Partners
items.summary: Main venue partner: Rebel Media partner: Web3 Fjord Information partner: Daily Scandinavian We are always open for high-quality partnerships! If you'd like to give a…
items.content_html:
Main venue partner: Rebel
Media partner: Web3 Fjord
Information partner: Daily Scandinavian

We are always open for high-quality partnerships!

If you'd like to give a speech, please read our "Topics", "Quality" and "Presentations" sections.

If you'd like to join on of our events, please check the home page or "Events" section.

You can contact us via the "About us" page.

items.title: Topics
items.summary: There are a wide list of topics that we're ready to discuss and cover on our events. Topic focuses (list can and will be extended,…
items.content_html:
There are a wide list of topics that we're ready to discuss and cover on our events.

Topic focuses (list can and will be extended, so please contact us if you have a different talk anyway):

  • Crypto, Blockchain, FinTech & DAO
  • Startups, Pitches, Kickstarting, Crowdfunding, Ideas
  • Business Improvement, Success Stories, Challenges, Management Efficiency, etc.
  • Open-source Software, Linux & Unix, Development stacks, Programming languages
  • Open-source Hardware, Development, Use-cases
  • Networks, Network Security & Audit, Network Tooling, Data Centers & Monitoring
  • Cyber Security, Malware analysis, System Audit and Prevention, Logging
  • AI, NN, Language Models
  • Computer Game Design, Board Game Development
  • Cities of the future, futurology
  • Energy Sector
  • Communications
  • Consulting & Advising & Legal
  • Design, Architecture
  • Press, Journalism
  • Agriculture
  • Medical tech
  • Biology and bio-engineering, implants, sextech
  • Education & Meetups
  • Content production - movies, videos, audio, singing (making, editing)

Our events might be interesting for you, if you're one of these guys:

  • Software & hardware electronics enthusiast
  • Geek & nerd in one of the above mentioned fields
  • Prefer to open-source everything
  • Interested in AI & Robotics
  • Making own business or interested in becoming an entrepreneur
  • Looking into the future

Past presentations on the following topics can be found in the "Presentations" section.

If you would like to send a paper, talk, or a presentation, please do so on the according page "Papers".

items.title: International Tech Meetups
items.summary: Please join on our exciting journey with our first ITM issue, 17 February 2024. Location: Rebel Address: Universitetsgata 2, Oslo Date & Time: 17 February…
items.content_html:
Please join on our exciting journey with our first ITM issue, 17 February 2024.

Location: Rebel
Address: Universitetsgata 2, Oslo
Date & Time: 17 February 2024, 17:00
RSVP: on meetup
Map & Route: OpenStreetMap, Google map, Mapiliary, Other maps)
Venue website: rebel.no

There will be up to 4 topics covered. Extra special activities after the main event!

  • Den Ivanov — ITM Community announcement. Who we are, what we plan, how to join and help.
  • Małgorzata Janeczek — Screw perfect, aim for good enough. A brief story of how not to go nuts facing complexity (with a small advice for beginners).
  • Den Ivanov — We need better marketing for open-source software
  • Secret speaker — Check-out our announces soon.

International Tech Meetups consist of two parts:
* Oslo-based online+offline events
* Online events, streams: global

Please use the top navigation menu to learn more about our events and community.

items.title: About us
items.summary: We are International Tech Meetups - combination of decentralised and Oslo-based community. We do Tech Events, Streams. We support the best communities and invite the…
items.content_html:
We are International Tech Meetups - combination of decentralised and Oslo-based community.

We do Tech Events, Streams. We support the best communities and invite the best speakers. And, most importantly, we try to do things right.

Feel free to reach out us at post@itmeet.top.

Former community name: META*.

Non-commercial association registration is in process.

items.title: Tools
items.summary: Our favourites List of great tools that we use and can recommend. Include flexible, modular, open-source tools that are extremely useful in the according situations…
items.content_html:
Our favourites

List of great tools that we use and can recommend. Include flexible, modular, open-source tools that are extremely useful in the according situations (software, hardware, and beyond).

Feel free to send suggestions and feedback, do a speech about the according software or hardware product, or just browse around and gain knowledge.

Full transparency and neutrality note: all the tools in this section are our personal recommendations. None of this section or any other sections of this website is sponsored by anyone.  

Hardware

  • Framework Laptops
  • MNT Reform - Dev ARM Laptop
  • Raspberry Pi, Orange Pi (prototyping)
  • Steam Deck (mobility, gaming)

Software

  • Arch Linux (literally used for everything)
  • Firefox web browser
  • Publii (used to make this website)
  • Suckless Toolkit - recommended software that heavily follows KISS principles

Maker software

  • OpenSCAD - parametric modelling
  • Cura - 3D print preparation & slicing
  • Blender - modelling

items.title: Quality control
items.summary: We strongly believe that following high quality standards is essential to grow and support a great community. For us, developing a high quality events, services and…
items.content_html:
We strongly believe that following high quality standards is essential to grow and support a great community. For us, developing a high quality events, services and products means that we care about people. And we want to care about you all!

We can't say we care about people without proving the point. And our proof point is that all of our work, papers, releases, documents, are always free to use for any purposes.

If you have a feedback about event or a project that ITM were involved in, please provide it via the "Feedback" page.

At ITM, we strongly believe that the future of humanity could be only saved if we use scientific and open-source approach to the world around us.

So, the following points are important:

  • We share everything and encourage you to copy what you think is important. You're free to use all of our materials for any purposes. If you would like to hear the name of the license for our website and materials, you can refer to them as "Kopimi", "Copyleft", "WTFPL", "The Unlicense", or just "CC0/public domain".  Note: presentations or tools might have a separate licenses, please be aware of it.
  • We use open-source software and hardware ourselves and would like you to use the same. This way we can support community movements and grow them together. You can review a list of tools we use and recommend on the according "Tools" page.
  • We encourage you to communicate between each other and with us, too. Sharing is caring, so please do share more educational and technical materials. We're also welcoming a constructive feedback!
  • Accessibility and performance are really important both in the short and in the long run.
  • This website is statically generated and does not include any tracking information whatsoever. If we're going to use any sort of tracking in the future, we guarantee it to be completely anonymous and local, so no data will leave our servers.

items.title: Call for papers
items.summary: Read more about format of our event and topics covered at the "Topics" page. If you would like to speak or to be added to…
items.content_html:
Read more about format of our event and topics covered at the "Topics" page.

If you would like to speak or to be added to ITM Knowledge Base, please submit your presentations to papers@itmeet.top with according information (Date, Topic, Links, Documents, Handouts, Requirements, etc).

Please make sure your presentation is following most of the basic rules on the "Presentations" page. 

Each presentation and information paper should be submitted at least 3 days before the event.

Knowledge Base / partners / other documents can be submitted at any time.

We'll do our best to read all the papers and give feedback ASAP after receiving them.

Thanks for your collaboration and looking forward to see you on the event both offline and online!
